body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following has the same final in pinyin as the second character in the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 很 hěn (very)
options: Audio for 谁 shéi (who)
Audio for 家 jiā (family; home)
Audio for 猫 māo (cat)
body.correct: Job excellently done! The second character in 我们 wǒmen (we/us) is “men.” Of the options, 很 hěn (very) also has the final “en.”
body.incorrect: Very close. First pronounce the word to identify its second final and how it sounds. Then listen very carefully to the choices to see which one has the same sound.

body.quiz: Which of the following can you not use to refer to the word presented?
body.correct: Awesome job! 你们 nǐmen is the plural for “you.” You can use it to address a group with two or more people.
body.incorrect: Oops... think about what type of word it is and in what situation(s) you can use it.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can this word be used to complete?
options: 我今年_____岁 Wǒ jīnián _____ suì.
body.correct: You got it! 凶 xiōng means “mean,” and it is used in the second sentence—“My dog is a little mean.”
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of this word and how it can be used in a sentence properly.

body.quiz: Which of the following words is not the same part of speech as the word presented?
body.correct: Fabulous job! 善良 shànliáng is an adjective. Of the options, only汤 tāng (soup) is not an adjective. It’s a noun.
body.incorrect: So close! Think about what type of word it is (noun, pronoun, adjective, adverb… etc.). Then review the words in the choices to see which one does not belong.

body.quiz: In the phrase presented, what does 智慧 zhìhuì mean by itself?
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 智慧 zhìhuì by itself means “wisdom” as a noun.
body.incorrect: So close! Think about what the original phrase means, and when broken down, what each part refers to.
